thread.title: Global sales boost Flight Centre profits
thread.title_full: Global sales boost Flight Centre profits

title: Global sales boost Flight Centre profits
text:
Thu, Aug 27, 2015, 11:00 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 5 hrs. Global sales boost Flight Centre profits AAP – 11 minutes ago Print 
Travel company Flight Centre has lifted profits by nearly a quarter thanks to record global sales and strong earnings growth from its offshore business. 
The group's net profit climbed 24 per cent to $256.55 million in the year to June 30 from $206.9 million in 2013/14 while total revenues rose 6.8 per cent to $2.4 billion. 
However underlying profit dipped 3.4 per cent because of a slowdown in the Australian travel market and losses from the group's business in Canada. 
Flight Centre forecast its underlying pre-tax profit to rise to between $380 million and $390 million in the year ahead, up from $366.3 million in 2014/15. 
Shares in the company were $1.30, or four per cent, higher at $33.59 at 1042 AEST. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Billabong back in black with $4.2m profit AAP
